p: In the vegetation and seed bank of RS a total of 45 species were found, belonging to 22 families. Of this number 19 were exotic species (42%), and 12 of these are invasive (63%) ( Table 1; Fig 2). The Asteraceae, Poaceae, Brassicaceae and Plantaginaceae families accounted for 68% of the exotic species, most of which are invasive (e.g., Carduus thoermeri, Taraxacum officinale and Bromus tectorum) ( Fig 2; Table 1). In RA a total of 35 species were found, belonging to 17 families, where 11 species (31%) were exotic, and of this number 6 are invasive (55%). The Asteraceae, Poaceae and Brassicaceae families were the most common ( Table 1).
